title: 108_s2233
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Research Enhancement Act" and pertains to Environmental Protection Agency research activities. The Environmental Research Enhancement Act establishes the position of Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency. The Deputy Administrator is appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate, considering recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, the National Academy of Engineering, and the Science Advisory Board. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees the Office of Research and Development, the Office of Environmental Information, the Science Advisory Board, the Science Policy Council, and scientific activities in the regulatory program and regional offices of the Agency. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology is responsible for overseeing scientific and technical activities in the regulatory program and regional offices of the Agency. They also ensure that important scientific issues are identified and develop strategies to acquire and disseminate necessary scientific information. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees scientific and technical activities in regulatory and regional offices, ensuring important scientific issues are addressed. This includes coordinating scientific outreach, communication, quality assurance, and peer-review activities with academia, government agencies, and the private sector in the US and abroad. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology oversees scientific quality assurance, peer-review activities, and ensures valid and appropriately characterized scientific information is used in Agency decision-making. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development is appointed for a 6-year term, and senior researchers with distinguished achievements in environmental research can be recruited to the Office's laboratories. The Office will establish a program to recruit senior researchers with distinguished achievements in environmental research. Awards will be given to support research in advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train junior researchers. Selection procedures will be established in consultation with the Science Advisory Board and the Board of Scientific Counselors. The Office will establish a program to recruit senior researchers with distinguished achievements in environmental research. Awards will be given for a 5-year period and may be renewed. Each laboratory must have at least 1 senior researcher appointed under the program. Appropriations are authorized for this subsection. The Office aims to give research managers flexibility and accountability in decision-making. The Office aims to empower research managers with flexibility and accountability in decision-making, maintain a balance between core and problem-driven research, develop strategies to acquire and apply research from various sources, and improve documentation and transparency in decision-making processes. The Office aims to improve documentation and transparency in decision-making processes, including establishing priorities, making assignments, and allocating funds. The Administrator of the Agency is tasked with increasing efforts to disseminate research products, explain their significance, and assist others in applying the results. The Agency aims to expand its science inventory by documenting all scientific activities conducted by Agency units. This includes project goals, milestones, principal investigators, and resource allocations. The results will be used to coordinate activities through the Agency-wide science planning and budgeting process. The Agency plans to expand its science inventory to document all scientific activities, ensuring proper coordination through the Agency-wide science planning and budgeting process. Additionally, the peer-review policy will be changed to enhance independence and separate the management of work product development from peer review. The position of Deputy Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency is now the "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency." The Environmental Protection Agency has redesigned the position of Deputy Administrator to be the "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management of the Environmental Protection Agency." This change also affects the Executive Schedule Level III.
